newsitem.title: GREECE: Ecu/drachma, fx forwards firm in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Ecu/drachma, fx forwards firm in late trade.

text.p: Ecu/drachma firmed on increased demand from foreign investors, fixed coupon bonds firmed and forex forwards had a slow day rising 10 basis points, dealers said.
"Ecu/drachma opened higher on buying interest from abroad. There is a bias to the upside," said a treasury sales officer at ABN AMRO bank.
Buying interest for bonds concentrated on fixed coupon bonds, especially those issued in November and December, dealers said.
Interest on FRNs was subdued gaining only 10 points due to inflows from mutual funds, dealers said.
Depos had a very quiet day because they had discounted the cut in the Bank of Greece's overnight bid by 50 basis points to 11.90 from 12.40 percent, on Friday.
"We are expecting a new rate cut by the central bank," said the treasury sales officer.
The mark was quoted at 156.40/45 drachmas from Monday's 156.430 fix, the dollar at 265.03/13 drachmas from 265.070 and the Ecu at 304.02/12 from 304.100 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
